title: What is the answer to a+(b-c) =? - Quora

response.answer_text: The answer depends on what the values are. a, b, and c here are specific values. For instance, if a is 10, b is 6, and c is 1, then this is 15. You need to know more than you gave in the question in order to get to anything that could be called an answer. Perhaps(?) what you’re asking is “What do you get when you simplify (a+(b-c)) ? But that’s a different question.
Does not the commutative law of addition apply…? a+(b−c)=a−c+b=−c+b+aa+(b−c)=a−c+b=−c+b+a a−(b−c)=a−b+ca−(b−c)=a−b+c
